thread.title: Watch Cee Lo Green Praise Beyonce With Outrageous 'Jay Z's Girl'
thread.title_full: Watch Cee Lo Green Praise Beyonce With Outrageous 'Jay Z's Girl'

title: Watch Cee Lo Green Praise Beyonce With Outrageous 'Jay Z's Girl'
text:
Cee Lo Green flipped Rick Springfield's "Jessie's Girl" into an outrageous ode to Beyoncé called, "Jay Z's Girl." Related Dungeon Family and Outkast Reunite in Atlanta for Family Affair to Remember The outlandish singer says fans should get ready for 'an onslaught of music this year' 
Released under his new Gnarly Davidson moniker, the track perfectly apes the instrumentals of Springfield's 1981 hit but features Green crooning a ridiculous new set of lyrics: "Jay Z is the king/ And I'm probably his biggest fan/ But there's a feeling inside that he'd surely understand/ I'm in love with B and I want to be her man." 
The equally absurd video for the song was directed by John Colombo and features a little kid lip-syncing the lyrics in his room while he swoons over posters of Beyoncé and praises a constellation of her face in the sky. 
"Jay Z's Girl" follows Green's previous Gnarly Davidson release, "Fuck Me I'm Famous." Green also arrived at the Grammys Sunday as Gnarly Davidson, wearing an entirely gold outfit. More News
